bug.author: Svendegroote91
bug.summary: Deploy v0.5.0 error "couldn't add package katib-v1alpha2"
bug.description: I am following the instructions on <denchmark-link:https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/deploy/deploy-cli/>https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/deploy/deploy-cli/</denchmark-link> to deploy the latest Kubeflow via the CLI. However, when running the following command kfctl generate all -V --zone ${ZONE} I get the following error: <denchmark-code>couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for ksonnet: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't add package katib-v1alpha2. Error: there was a problem installing package katib-v1alpha2: resolving package metadata: kubeflow/katib-v1alpha2: open /Users/svendegroote/project_dir/kubeflow-sven/.cache/master/kubeflow/katib-v1alpha2/parts.yaml: no such file or directory </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.73. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
It seems that this was fixed with the v0.5.1 release, closing the issue.
